intro: Elytrophorus globularis, commonly known as the globe-shaped moss, is a member of the family Hypnaceae. It is a small, cushion-like plant that forms dense, rounded clusters on rocks and soil. The plant has a dark green to reddish-brown color, depending on its moisture level. Its leaves are typically short, curved, and arranged in a spiral pattern. Elytrophorus globularis is often found in moist, shaded environments, such as forest floors and rock crevices.
